content: Government of Singapore from 2024 to 2025 The **First Cabinet of Lawrence Wong** of the [Government of Singapore](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) was announced on 13 May 2024, and came into effect on 15 May 2024 and ended on 23 May 2025. ## Changes There are minimal changes to the Cabinet line-up following the swearing-in of Lawrence Wong as Prime Minister. Minister for Trade and Industry [Gan Kim Yong](/wiki/Gan_Kim_Yong) was promoted to [Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore), while retaining his existing ministerial role. MinistersAppointment[Gan Kim Yong](/wiki/Gan_Kim_Yong)[Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) and [Minister for Trade and Industry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Trade_and_Industry_(Singapore)) ## Composition The First Lawrence Wong Cabinet is composed of the following members. On 16 April 2024, then Prime Minister-designate [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) announced that then outgoing Prime Minister [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) would assume the office of Senior Minister and stay on in his cabinet after stepping down as the Prime Minister on 15 May 2024.
